P2HNNS.utils package

Submodules

P2HNNS.utils.FHQuery module

class P2HNNS.utils.FHQuery.FHQuery(query, data, top, limit, l, dist)[source]

Bases: Query

Represents a query for point-to-hyperplane nearest neighbor searches specifically for the Furthest Hyperplane (FH) hashing method. This class encapsulates the details of the query hyperplane, the dataset against which the query is executed, and parameters such as the number of top results to return and a limit for search optimization.

Attributes / Parameters for initialization:

query (np.array): The hyperplane coefficients representing the query. data (np.ndarray): The dataset array against which the query will be executed. top (int): The number of top nearest neighbors to return. limit (int): A limit for search optimization, possibly affecting the search algorithm’s performance or accuracy. l (int): Separation threshold dist (Dist): The distance function used to calculate distances between points and the hyperplane.

copy(self, dist

Dist) -> ‘Query’: Creates a deep copy of the current Query instance with a new distance function.

copy(dist)[source]

Creates a deep copy of this Query instance, allowing for the specification of a new distance function, while preserving the query, data, top, and limit parameters.

Parameters

dist (Dist) – The new distance function to use in the copied Query instance.

Returns

A new Query instance with the same query, data, top, and limit parameters, but using the

specified distance function.

Return type

Query

P2HNNS.utils.HashBucket module

class P2HNNS.utils.HashBucket.HashBucket(n: int, l: int)[source]

Bases: object

Implements a hash bucket system for efficiently managing and querying data using multiple hash tables. The class supports inserting data items and searching for items based on a query code, utilizing bitwise operations for hash code generation and management.

l

The number of hash tables (buckets) to be used.

Type

int

mask

A bitmask used to ensure hash codes fit within a certain range.

Type

int

buckets

A list of hash tables for storing data items, where each hash table is implemented as a defaultdict(list) for flexibility and efficiency.

Type

List[defaultdict[list]]

Parameters for intialization:

n (int): The expected size of the dataset, used to determine the range of hash codes. l (int): The number of hash tables (buckets) to create for data storage.

insert(key

int, dcode: np.array): Inserts a data item into the hash buckets.

search(qcode, limit

int, consumer: Callable) -> Dict: Searches for data items that match a query code.

get_or_empty(bucket

Dict, hashcode32: int) -> List: Retrieves items from a bucket based on a hash code, returning an empty list if no items are found.

swap(as_list

List, bs_list: List, aidx: int, bidx: int): Swaps items between two lists at specified indices.

get_or_insert(map_obj

Dict, idx: int) -> List: Retrieves or initializes a list in a map for a given index.

is_empty() → bool[source]

Returns True if no data has been added to the HashBucket, otherwise False.

get_or_empty(bucket: Dict, hashcode32: int) → List[source]

Retrieves the list of items associated with a hash code from a bucket, or an empty list if no items are found.

Parameters

  • bucket (defaultdict[list]) – The bucket from which to retrieve items.

  • hashcode32 (int) – The hash code used to look up items in the bucket.

Returns

The list of items associated with the hash code, or an empty list if none are found.

Return type

list

get_or_insert(map_obj: Dict, idx: int) → List[source]

Retrieves a list from a map object for a given index. If the index does not exist, a new list is initialized.

Parameters

  • map_obj (defaultdict[list]) – The map from which to retrieve or initialize the list.

  • idx (int) – The index for which to retrieve or initialize the list.

Returns

The list associated with the given index in the map object.

Return type

list

insert(key: int, dcode: array)[source]

Inserts a data item identified by a key into the hash buckets using the provided hash codes.

Parameters

  • key (int) – The identifier for the data item to be inserted.

  • dcode (np.array) – An array of hash codes for the data item, one for each hash table.

is_empty() → bool[source]

Checks if the HashBucket is empty.

Returns

True if no data has been added to any of the hash tables, otherwise False.

Return type

bool

search(qcode, limit: int, consumer: Callable) → Dict[source]

Searches for data items that match the query code, using a consumer function to process each found item.

Parameters

  • qcode – The query code used to search for matching data items.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of candidate items to find before stopping the search.

  • consumer (Callable) – A function to be called for each data item found during the search.

Returns

A dictionary with keys as item identifiers and values as the count of matches.

Return type

defaultdict[int, int]

swap(as_list: List, bs_list: List, aidx: int, bidx: int)[source]

Swaps items between two lists at specified indices.

Parameters

  • as_list (list) – The first list from which an item will be swapped.

  • bs_list (list) – The second list with which an item from the first list will be swapped.

  • aidx (int) – The index in the first list of the item to swap.

  • bidx (int) – The index in the second list of the item to swap.

P2HNNS.utils.IdxVal module

class P2HNNS.utils.IdxVal.IdxVal(idx, value)[source]

Bases: object

Represents an ordered pair consisting of an index and a value, where ordering is primarily based on the value, and secondarily (in case of equal values) on the index. This class supports comparison operations allowing objects of this class to be sorted or compared directly.

Attributes / Parameters for initialization:

idx (int): The index part of the ordered pair. value (Any): The value part of the ordered pair, can be of any type that supports comparison operations.

__eq__(self, other)[source]

Checks equality between this object and another based on their values and indices.

__lt__(self, other)[source]

Defines the less-than ordering between this object and another.

__repr__(self)[source]

Returns an unambiguous string representation of this object.

class P2HNNS.utils.RQALSH.RQALSH(n: int, dim: int, m: int, index: array, norm: array, data: List[List[IdxVal]], scan_size=1600, check_error=1e-05)[source]

Bases: object

Implements the Reverse Query-Aware Locality Sensitive Hashing algorithm.

The number of data points.

Type

int

dim

The dimensionality of the data points.

Type

int

The number of hash tables.

The maximum number of points to scan in each hash table.

Type

int

The error tolerance for checking candidates.

Type

float

a

The generated hash functions.

Type

tables

The hash tables storing data points and their hash values.

Type

List

Parameters for initialiaztion:

n (int): The number of data points. dim (int): The dimensionality of the data points. m (int): The number of hash tables. index (np.array): The indices of the data points. norm (np.array): The norm used to calculate the hash values. data (List[List[IdxVal]]): The data points to index. scan_size (int): The maximum number of points to scan in each hash table. check_error (float): The error tolerance for checking candidates.

get_search_position(sample_dim

int, query: List[IdxVal]) -> SearchPosition: Determine the search positions for a given query in the hash tables.

find_radius(w

float, position: SearchPosition) -> float: Find the search radius based on the query and the data distribution.

int, limit: int, R: float, position: SearchPosition) -> List:

Dynamically count and identify candidate data points close to the query.

fns(l: int, limit: int, R: float, sampledim: int, query: List[IdxVal]) -> List:

Find the nearest neighbors for a given query.

dynamic_separation_counting(l: int, limit: int, R: float, position: SearchPosition) → List[source]

Dynamically counts and identifies candidate data points that are close to the query point using separation counting.

Parameters

  • l (int) – The minimum number of occurrences across hash tables to consider a data point as a candidate.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of candidates to return.

  • R (float) – The initial search radius.

  • position (SearchPosition) – The current search positions of the query in the hash tables.

Returns

A list of candidate data points that are within the search radius of the query.

Return type

List

find_radius(w: float, position: SearchPosition) → float[source]

Finds the optimal search radius based on the distances of the closest points in the hash tables to the query.

Parameters

  • w (float) – The width parameter used to adjust the search radius.

  • position (SearchPosition) – The current search positions of the query in the hash tables.

Returns

The new search radius determined based on the median of the closest distances.

Return type

float

fns(l: int, limit: int, R: float, sampledim: int, query: List[IdxVal]) → List[source]

Finds the nearest neighbors to a given query within a specified radius.

This method performs a dynamic separation counting to identify candidates and then filters these candidates based on the provided radius and limit criteria.

Parameters

  • l (int) – The minimum number of occurrences across hash tables to consider a data point as a candidate.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of candidates to return.

  • R (float) – The search radius within which to find nearest neighbors.

  • sampledim (int) – The dimensionality of the sample data points.

  • query (List[IdxVal]) – The query represented as a list of index-value pairs.

Returns

A list of indices of the nearest neighbors within the specified radius to the query.

Return type

List

get_search_position(sample_dim: int, query: List[IdxVal]) → SearchPosition[source]

Determines the initial search positions for a given query in the hash tables.

Parameters

  • sample_dim (int) – The dimensionality of the sample data points.

  • query (List[IdxVal]) – The query data points.

Returns

An object representing the positions within hash tables for the given query.

Return type

SearchPosition

P2HNNS.utils.RandomSampler module

class P2HNNS.utils.RandomSampler.RandomSampler(dim: int, s: int)[source]

Bases: object

A class performing random sampling from a dataset using a strategy combining probabilistic and deterministic features to ensure a diverse and representative selection of samples. This sampler is particularly designed to handle high-dimensional data and is capable of capturing both individual and interactive effects between data dimensions through a unique sampling mechanism.

The sampling strategy involves: 1. Creating a cumulative probability vector based on the squared values of the data, emphasizing

regions with higher magnitude for selection.

  1. Deterministically selecting the initial sample from the end of the dimension space, ensuring the inclusion of edge data.

  2. Probabilistically selecting subsequent samples based on the cumulative probability distribution, with adjustments to explore cross-dimension interactions.

  3. Preventing the selection of duplicate samples by maintaining a record of already-selected samples.

dim

The dimension of the input data.

Type

int

afterdim

The computed dimension to consider after processing, accommodating cross-dimension sampling.

Type

int

sampledim

The dimension of the sample to be drawn, calculated as the product of dim and a scaling factor s.

Type

int

Parameters for initialization:

dim (int): The dimension of the input data. s (int): A scaling factor to determine the size of the sample relative to the input data’s dimension.

probability_vector(dim: int, data: array) → array[source]

Generate a probability vector from the input data.

Parameters

  • dim (int) – The dimension of the input data.

  • data (np.array) – The input data array.

Returns

A probability vector for the input data.

Return type

np.array

sampling(data: array) → List[IdxVal][source]

Perform random sampling from the given data utilizing a strategy that combines probabilistic selection with deterministic checks to ensure a diverse and comprehensive sample set. This method specifically targets capturing both the individual and interactive effects between data dimensions through a nuanced sampling mechanism.

Parameters

data (np.array) – The input data array from which to sample.

Returns

A list of IdxVal objects representing the sampled indices and their corresponding

values squared (for individual dimensions) or multiplied (for cross dimensions), ensuring a varied representation of the dataset’s characteristics.

Return type

List[IdxVal]

search_idx_from(d: int, prob: array) → int[source]

Generate a probability vector from the input data, which is used to guide the probabilistic selection of samples. This vector is a cumulative sum of the squared values of the data, emphasizing areas of higher magnitude for selection, facilitating a biased sampling towards significant features in the data.

Parameters

  • dim (int) – The dimension of the input data.

  • data (np.array) – The input data array.

Returns

A probability vector for the input data, used to guide the sampling process.

Return type

np.array

class P2HNNS.utils.SortedLCCS.SortedLCCS(step: int, data: ndarray, scan_size: int = 4)[source]

Bases: object

Implements Sorted Longest Circular Co-Substring (LCCS) search algorithm for multi-dimensional data.

binary_search_loc(query: array, query_dim: int, low: int, low_len: int, high: int, high_len: int) → Loc[source]

Uses binary search to find the approximate location of a query in the dataset.

Parameters

  • query (np.array) – The query array.

  • query_dim (int) – The dimension of the query.

  • low (int) – The lower bound of the search range.

  • low_len (int) – The length at the lower bound.

  • high (int) – The upper bound of the search range.

  • high_len (int) – The length at the upper bound.

Returns

The located position of the query in the search space.

Return type

Loc

Identifies candidate matches for the query by scanning the dataset and applies a callable to each.

Parameters

  • query (np.array) – The query array.

  • f (Callable) – A function to apply to each found index.

Returns

A dictionary with indices of candidates and the number of times each was checked.

Return type

compare_dim_indices(idx1: int, idx2: int, start: int, walked: int) → CmpLoc[source]

Compares elements at given indices of the dataset in a circular manner.

Parameters

  • idx2 (int) – The index of the second element in the dataset.

  • start (int) – The starting dimension for comparison.

  • walked (int) – The initial offset in the dimension.

Returns

The result of the comparison and the total distance walked in the dimension.

Return type

CmpLoc

compare_dim_vectors(xs: array, ys: array, start: int, walked: int) → CmpLoc[source]

Compares two arrays element-wise in a circular manner starting from a given index.

Parameters

  • xs (np.array) – The first array to compare.

  • ys (np.array) – The second array to compare.

  • start (int) – The starting index for comparison.

  • walked (int) – The distance already walked in the comparison.

Returns

A CmpLoc object containing the distance walked and comparison result.

Return type

CmpLoc

class P2HNNS.utils.distance_functions.DistDP2H[source]

Bases: Dist

Distance from a data point p to the hyperplane query q. DP2H aims to find the k closest data points to the hyperplane query.

Calculate the distance between query and data.

P2HNNS.utils.operations.concat(data: ndarray, dimensions: array) → ndarray[source]

Concatenates a 1D array to each row of a 2D array, effectively adding a new dimension to the data.

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – The original 2D array.

  • dimensions (np.array) – The 1D array to concatenate to each row of ‘data’.

Returns

The concatenated array.

Return type

np.ndarray

Raises

AssertionError – If the length of ‘dimensions’ does not match the number of rows in ‘data’.

P2HNNS.utils.operations.normalize(data: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Normalizes the rows of a 2D array such that each row has a mean of 0 and a norm of 1.

Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – The data to normalize.

Returns

The normalized data.

Return type

np.ndarray
